page.title: 03 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Another village of historic interest is Harley which has a number of treasures within the church. A crude Norman is there and also a fine small 15th Century chest which has iron bands. The silver Paten is over 500 years old and has an engraved head of Christ as well as a small flower on either side. Threre is also an Elizabethian silver chalice. There are three panels of old glass showing the Salutation, Nativity and Presentation in the temple. In the tower, which is 15th Century, is an unnamed brass of a man in armour. It is thought that this brass could be a memorial to Sir Richard Lacon, Sheriff of Shrewsbury in 1477. Benjamin Jenks, who wrote many prayers and meditations, was Rector here for 56 years.
